name: Column (itch)
description:
You are a metaphorical civil servant in an authoritarian regime and your job is to hold up the metaphorical pillars of government: 

- Strength - Methaphorically represented by Chess
- Unity - Methaphorically represented by Card Flipping
- Order - Methaphorically represented by the Towers of Hanoi
- Oversight - Methaphorically represented by Checkers
(Note: We have far more on the way, we hope to expand the game outside LD50)

While your job may seem may seem futile, it is an important part of holding up our thrown. To do these you need to use your brain to confront a few puzzles to distract you from the the non-nefarious deeds that you are allowing to happen.

-----------------------------------------------------

On this game worked:

- Glow - Our programmer, resident maniac and head of this project. Works perfectly to the moment when things go down south, then it is pain in the ass to work with him

- Fjana - Our graphical designer who also came up with the game idea and mechanics, (also wrote this description, hello dear world!), did many miscellaneous tasks in the process

- Gar - Our sound engineer, our resident American thanks to which we have to switch between our native language and english constantly because he joins our voice chat on random occasions

-----------------------------------------------------

Controls:

- Arrow keys: Movement

- R: Restart

-----------------------------------------------------

- Godot v3.2.2
- Aseprite v1.2.25

-----------------------------------------------------

Some things you might find interesting:

- There are some easter eggs in the game, hope you find at least some

- We have more cringy & stupid jokes on our profile describtion

- Each game is an allegory, either by name, by mechanics or by a connection to an authoritarian regimes

- The Democracy Index average of the world has been steadily dropping for the last 8 years

- 59 countries are currently ranked by the Democracy Index as "Authoritarian". Those countries currently have a 37.1% of the world population, approximately 2.88 billion people

- 23 democracies are now according to the V-Dem Institute currently in the process of autocratization

-----------------------------------------------------

AND FINALLY: THIS IS NOT AN ENCOURAGEMENT OF AUTHORITARIAN REGIMES, NOR IS IT PROMOTING BUILDING THOSE. PLEASE PLAY UNTIL THE END NOT TO MISS THE POINT
